p: As early as 2004, ACE2 tampering was suggested to be an important mechanism in SARS-CoV-1 infection ( 30, 31). It was only later discovered that CoV possesses very specific mechanisms to escape the host's immunity ( 32). These mechanisms, in addition to the pro-inflammatory response secondary to ACE2 binding, might act as a trigger for a sustained and uncontrolled inflammatory response, leading to ARDS.
